channel.title: Beginners Help Needed: Music Thing Modular
channel.description: So I put my music thing together, and I'm wondering where to go from here. How do I get the axoloti to read the music thing so I can start routing patches to the controls? Are there any good tutorial patches that can help get my feet off the ground? Is there a thread that I completely looked over that has all the information I need?

item.title: Beginners Help Needed: Music Thing Modular
item.dc:creator: @Tombola Tom Whitwell
item.description:
@Tombola wrote:

Yes, I bought an Axoloti, wanted a control board, designed it, open sourced it under a CC-BY-SA Open Hardware license. I design Music Thing Modular modules, so I put a MTM logo on the PCB.

I have sometimes referred to it as 'axo control', which infringes a little on the Axoloti brand but hopefully isn't a big issue.

Read full topic
item.source: Beginners Help Needed: Music Thing Modular

item.title: Beginners Help Needed: Music Thing Modular
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

SirPrimalform:

But isn't MTM his brand?

Sure!

SirPrimalform:

It's certainly not the name of the control board at least.

Tom Withwell (@Tombola) designed it and gave it that name.

Read full topic

item.title: Beginners Help Needed: Music Thing Modular

item.description:
@johannes wrote:

SirPrimalform:

Axocontrol? MTM is a brandname.

The Music Thing Modular Axoloti Control Board is designed by @Tombola and available at Thonk

Read full topic
item.source: Beginners Help Needed: Music Thing Modular

item.title: Beginners Help Needed: Music Thing Modular
item.dc:creator: @SirPrimalform
item.description:
@SirPrimalform wrote:

Wait... you mean the Axocontrol? MTM is a brandname.

On the subject of this, is there any way to PWM all the LEDs and read all the pots at the same time? The PWM object that addresses a couple of LEDs also addresses a couple of the pins used to read the pots and it messes it all up. Would the problem be avoided by an object which only addresses the LED pins or is the reason it does both at once because they're tied together in the hardware support?

Read full topic
item.source: Beginners Help Needed: Music Thing Modular

item.source: Beginners Help Needed: Music Thing Modular

item.title: Beginners Help Needed: Music Thing Modular
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

Hey

Check this thread. I have created a couple of subpatches for the Modular thingy thing. You can get them here:

MusicThingModular Controller subpatch

Try this one out. I have made a test version for the 6 knobs. You use the first button on the right to choose between layer 1 & 2. It is pretty sijple to add the last stuff from here. Or else you can also check Tom Whitwells patch on Github. It shows how to set up everything. You need to use @hellcores hookmod object for this patch to work. There are 2 versions. One that uses the cv from the gpio directly and one that converts the gpios to midi cc. Layer 1 is midi cc 1-6 and layer 2 is midi ccâ€¦

It is setup, so it basicly has got 2 functions/layers for each knob. There is a short description in the patch on ow to switch between layers.

Read full topic
item.source: Beginners Help Needed: Music Thing Modular
